intro: Eleocharis grossimucronata, commonly known as the broad-tipped spike-rush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wet or marshy environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikelets that are often white or pale green. Its inflorescence consists of multiple spikelets arranged in a dense, cylindrical shape, which is characteristic of many rush species. Eleocharis grossimucronata is adapted to waterlogged soils and plays a role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems.
